metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5784 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Incorrect handling of deferred code in V8 in Google Chrome prior to72.0.3626.96 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heapcorruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5784` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
